benchmark_details.name: CLOTHO
benchmark_details.overview: CLOTHO is a task-specific, pre-generation adequacy measure that estimates input difficulty directly from hidden LLM states, aiming to improve testing efficiency by prioritizing which inputs to run and label first.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: Improve task-specific LLM testing by prioritizing inputs for human labeling to expose failures earlier and reduce testing costs.

data.source: Empirical evaluation across various LLM tasks and datasets created for measuring input adequacy.
data.annotation: Human-labeled inputs based on model performance assessments.

methodology.calculation: Calculated likelihood of passing inputs through GMM based on hidden states.
methodology.interpretation: Higher ROC-AUC indicates better prediction of input adequacy and failure rates.
methodology.baseline_results: Achieved a ROC-AUC of 0.716 in predicting correctness with limited labeling.
